U70tVRrvskVYldzqhSLibg.text: Ordered filet medium rare.  It arrived medium well. Lighting is bad so I tasted it to discover it was wrong.  Mentioned it to Steven (great waiter our favorite).   The owner followed him back to table stating " we need a flashlight".   To check the wellness of the meat.   No one in the restaurant had one so my husband got out his phone.   IT was actually well done   Surprise.   The owner made a spectacle of himself.   My husband s food was great as usually is mine.  Cannot day enough about Steven our waiter. He was fabulous    The owner needs supervision and manners.  The steak was finally delivered after my husband finished his meal raw.   We took it home to cook it.   What an amazing disapppointment.   The owner never returned with his flashlight.   Then the owner follows us out to say we are no longer welcome.   Crazy evening.  On our way to americana for a real steak

RcieYxhw7IiuSK2UMozmKA.text: Portobello appetizer fab!  Orecchiette amazing!  Friday night entertainer, the REALDeal. Kacy Machacyk!  we will be back!

C_VzijTVKwTXcm_Wv7T-bg.text: On Friday May 11th my classmates and I had reservations @ Mezzo for our completion from our CNA program. We had a pre-fixed menu made up for us, the food was fabulous!!!!!!!!!!!!! The caprese salad was a real hit, and the chicken picatta was outstanding, our entire menu was just absolutely awesome. Oh did I forget to mention the sangria WOW!!!!!!!!!!!. The staff was great and sooooooo super attentive and very nice. My classmates and I had the best experience and we will be returning.  Thank you to the entire staff for making our little celebration that much more special.

x0qAkYUux9f9smRuOa0LIA.text: I ordered the gnocchi and it was very good. The reason for only 4 stars was the price.  The staff was good too, very accommodating to our needs.

EfdZq6h3jhZjLIryNvoJCA.text: Omg  I cannot believe this place was not full! seriously great food! if they were on the strip they would not only fit in, but could charge twice as much as they do. I was pleased! we go here now every time we are in town!

mdiAo1gQAMg0RyyipxHdWQ.text: Went there because I had bought a Groupon for it. Went for dinner on a Saturday night, was told there was a 15-20 minute wait when we arrived, even though there were 4-5 tables open at the time. We sat at the bar and waited and kept asking each other why was there a wait when 4-5 tables were open?  When it came time to seat us, the hostess took us to one of the tables near then bar that had been open the entire time. Found it very irritating that they made us sit at the bar and wait for 20 minutes only to be seated at a table that had been open the entire time. Our waiter was friendly enough, but had to ask what the specials were, he didnt even mention them even though they were all listed on a huge chalk board on the wall. He raved about the 8oz. filet special, so we both ordered it , and asked for medium well. When the entree's arrived mine was more medium rare, but was ok, wasnt going to send it back for that, but my girlfriends was blood red raw. We told the waiter that it was not medium well, but raw. He agreed that it was not done, and took it back to the kitchen. He came back a few minutes later and said "if you think it looked raw out here, you should have seen it under the light in the kitchen, it was really raw".  All they did was take it off of our bill, didnt offer to bring out another one, or even offer her anything else to eat, so we left with her having no dinner. Since they took her entree of the bill, I didnt need to use the Groupon.  The experiance was so bad I doubt we will go back to even use it. Just going to write it off as a bad dining experiance and move on. I'm still wondering how they could serve a filet without noticing that it was raw, and it was one the highly rated specials that night.

lrzcADV_Mohkk0k2Q91M_g.text: When I ask for water w lemon I want lemon!  Tutti mari needs to be drained before added to the sauce, so it doesn't become soup. Caesar salad was soaking in dressing. Had to ask for more bread. Sorry this place would be out of business if in a real city.  Didn't help that I got food poisoning symptoms 4 hours later!

lUsM-Bj7egkF6z2rhob05w.text: Went to Mezzo Bistro because I purchased the Mystery Date on Groupon.  I called ahead to ask a few questions and the girl was very polite and helpful.    When we arrived for dinner, we were seated immediately.  It took a little time before our server greeted us.  We were a little frustrated when another couple was seated after us, and the server went to greet them first.  It seemed like they were regulars, but I still would have appreciated him greeting us sooner.  After he greeted us, the service was fine.  The food was delicious.  We got the shrimp cocktail (biggest shrimp I've ever seen) and the antipasto salad (which was enough to provide lunch the next day) as appetizers.  My husband got fettuccine alfredo with chicken and I got the grilled salmon.  Both were great!  The deal also came with 2 glasses of wine, we got Pinot Grigio, which we really enjoyed.  The Groupon was a great deal!    We were there awhile, but I don't mind a longer dinner in a place like that.  They had live music, which added to the cute atmosphere.  We really appreciated one of the owners stopping by to ask how things were going.  When we told him it was our first time there, he asked a few more questions about our experience.  We'll definitely be back!

j3Q23FmNrChNwL45ZD_VsA.text: Absolutely love this place. This is the second time I have been here and, somehow, the food was better than the already outstanding food we had the first time. The calamari we had as an appetizer was cooked perfectly. For the entrees, I got the Chicken Riggies and my boyfriend got the Gnocchi and we both loved them. Atmosphere is great, servers are attentive and hats off to the chef! If you haven't been here yet, you're missing out!

wmntdtjX8NMF31TekManEw.text: Horrible service with 4 waiters and maybe 6 tables when we got there.  Forgot to put our order in and 2 hours later finally got our meal.  One Burnt meal. One was cold and Owner said "he couldn't do anything more than  take the one meal off the bill". Owner Stormed off frustrated because we obviously weren't the only ones complaining.  Will never be back!!!!!   If I could post with no stars I would.

Y8MKLJUxPGECG7HROWE_bA.text: I've had dinner here several times. After my lunch experience today I am not sure I will ever return. For starters I was  charged a dollar for a TO GO order. I highly dislike being charged  for the few steps I took on my own accord to pick up my food. I understand charging for a delivery fee. However, I walked from literally next door. And, when I placed the order not once did they mention there'd be a charge. I ordered with at least fifteen minutes notice of when I needed the food and was told my order would be ready for pick up within ten minutes. Upon my arrival not only was there no greeter at the door, my food had not yet been prepared. As I am on a limited amount of time for lunch this was an inconvenience. I ordered the Brie grilled cheese sandwich. It should be renamed to a grilled bread with mushrooms, onions and perhaps some cheese sandwich. I paid good money for a sandwich that did not have much of the main ingredient-cheese. I was highly disappointed and WILL NOT be ordering lunch there again.

gUTFPJNiQafy2WPUf4jM2A.text: Mezzo serves up quality Italian food at a reasonable price. I frequent this joint that is lost in the northwest valley on Rancho. I have yet to be disappointed with a single dish. Their antipasto salad is a great way to start out the meal. It serves 2-4 people and will get your taste buds going for the main course. As for entrees, it may be simple, but the eggplant parmesan is wonderful. Also, pay attention to the specials. There are often creative and great daily dishes. For dessert, the tiramisu is divine. The wine list is solid and they will often have wine specials. The decor is decent, but a little too cookie-cutter Italian for my tastes. The service is usually satisfactory, but there have been some letdowns. If you plan to go, check out Groupon, as they often run deals through there.

MrV_cL4ksWk1zj6hpnqnvQ.text: Never realized this place existed and found it because of a GroupOn. It was very nice. Though a little loud, it had a dark, romantic setting. There was live music, good food, attentive service and it was reasonably priced. Despite it being a Friday night, we got right in and not because the place wasn't busy - it was.

19KSDq_x_fz79AdFFAmv9Q.text: I went to eat at Mezzo for Valentines and it was good. We started off by sharing an appetizer fig pizza. I must say the small pieces of fig really complemented the flavors of the Cheese. Entrees took a long time getting out but when you're with good company this is not a big deal. Food finally came out and a huge portion of Veal Parmesan arrived along with a perfectly cooked med-rare filet. This is a good place to eat the only thing I would not recommend is their Sangria, it tastes like grape juice. We had a taste of both red and white and they were just too sweet.

fc9CyaV1_-06FKFUXaHDQA.text: My husband and I tried this place out on a groupon, and we will definitely be back. It is a beautiful place, and the food...... Oh...So.... GOOD... This was a few days ago, and I am still thinking about it. I got the chicken riggies and hubby got the lasagna. It was quite literally the best Italian food I have had in years. The prices aren't bad either. The only gripe I may have is that there are a few bad tables in the place, just try not to get seated in them. One is a round table right by the bathrooms, and the other is a 2 top right outside the swinging door that the servers exit the kitchen from. You get a small draft every time it opens.

d1FDKiRTHZ5gBnGI131rMQ.text: Absolute favorite Italian restaurant. The Chicken Riggies is a great dish from Upstate NY. Someone in your party should get it. Nice to go to a local restaurant that isn't a chain. They do lots of great deals on FB, Yelp, Restaurant.com.

VWBiqqmfBXX2CgBRhDqJXA.text: Went here for the first time because of a $50 off ($100 total bill) coupon from restaurants.com. The food was great. We knew we had to spend $33 per person (three of us) because of the coupon restrictions of $100 total. My wife and son had a couple of glasses of white wine, a salad (or soup) and an entree. I had water, the salad, soup, entree and a desert. Our bill was $103. The food was great! We were able to have exactly what we wanted and stay within our budget. Service was top shelf for sure! Stephanee, our server, was very polite and right on top of everything that we needed. My water glass was never empty and the wine service was always on time. Food came out (very) hot and warm bread on the table was made plentiful. With a $20 tip, total pay out for 3 ppl and a great meal was $73. Pretty good. If I HAD to make a critique, there was wax dripped down the back of the seat. No big deal, but attention to those details in a gourmet room is well received. Will we be back? Yup!

_5A-fEGlT-sIJ0_3PHPs5A.text: For the area, this restaurant is amazing. It is hard to find quality food on the border of North Las Vegas.  The only reason I am giving this place 3 stars is because the service does not match the quality of food. The food is absolutely delicious and I highly recommend the salmon as an appetizer. The staff however, is very slow. It takes the food way too long to get to your table even when it is not busy, so go here when you are not in a rush!

oqUQKnh3EwKBrlw8PF0b1Q.text: We went to enjoy their happy hour last evening at the bar. The service wes very good and all of the staff behind the bar seemed very attentive and was a pleasure to deal with. When we left Mezzo, the establishment was about 75% full and is usually a good indication of both quality of food and good service. We sampled both the beet salad and calamari appetizers.  Both were very good and I would recommend and order them again. The house Cabarnet was fairly good and only $3/per glass.  Good value and was a decent quality.  Our bill was $48 for two, not including the tip. We attemped to use the Groupon/AmazonLocal coupon that we purchaed for $12 and the staff at the resturant told us that they would not honor it because we ordered from the Happy Hour menu.  The Happy Hour menu did not mention this fact and the coupon/voucher that we purchaed did not mention this on their disclosues and termf of use.  Beyond this, I would say that our experience was plessant and favorable in every other way. We will probably revisit this establishment in the future.

TOYusNCt3RUBtwwFz99jHw.text: I really want to like this place.  My husband and I have been there many times alone and multiple times with guests.  Why do you keep going back you ask?  It's close to home and locally owned.  I can say the staff has gotten nicer and the food has gotten worse.  My husband likes pepper on his salad the our waiter told us the chef refuses to have salt and pepper for the table.  Sometimes the wait staff will offer fresh ground pepper and others act annoyed (they use to ALL act annoyed).  Their wine list is pretty good but in my opinion restaurants also need good service and food.  Food is mediocre.  Their soup and salads are the best thing on the menu.  I've also ordered chicken, fish, pasta and pizza and it's just okay.  We brought guests for the chefs special "surprise me" (sorry forgot the name) and it was okay.  We had 1 vegetarian in the group and we all wished we all had requested the vegetarian option.  Funny thing is they don't really offer much meatless options on the menu but this night the chef must of came out of his box to surprised us.  Like other reviewers state....there are better Italian places in town but just not as  conveniently located.  I do hope their menu and food improves and when we are in the mood for some close to home, mediocre food we will stop in.

B6WjfiHgzmm3Nj7YG-0aBw.text: Make sure you PRINT the Facebook coupon if you want the discount that is splashed all over the menu boards. I dont know what kind of tech marketing expects people to actually Print a hard copy and then bring it.   The temperature outside was hot and the restaurant was warm inside also. I don't know if the AC was broken or it just couldn't cool it down, but it was uncomfortable.   The order took 45 minutes from the time it was placed until it was served, and we only had a salad and one of the specials.   The food was good, but not great. We eat out all the time and don't think this one will be high on my list.   This was our second visit and the first experience was similar.

Ialwam6MzgDENI5WJW7e9g.text: If it was up to me I would give them a -25 star. My family and I came in for dinner on a Tuesday night. We waited an hour before we even got water. We were not greeted at the door. We hada soy I allergy with one of the people at our table and the server never came back to let us know if any of the dishes had a soy allergy in it. We finally came out and said that we needed water after an hour of being there they finally brought our salad.We had had enough we left.

2upQFHjlDOgrbNOxLZST9g.text: Meh. Cheap happy hour wine, but food is wedding banquet variety bland. Portobello appetizer is a pasta dish with no pasta. A ventricle busting cheesy Alfredo soup with flavorless sauteed portobello and raw spinach...for an appetizer. Homemade orrecheite was stale and too chewy which means they over kneaded the pasta until it was tough or it was old and a exposed to air. The shame is the service is really attentive and friendly. The waitstaff probably loses a percentage of their tips every shift because people blame them for the food. If you know Italian food, not just pizza or spaghetti and meatballs, you will be disappointed.

2Gr3aqYy5MyQ4WfrANCR4A.text: We stumbled  on this place. Without reading any reviews it was in the afternoon. The place was very quiet but we needed a place to meet up with a friend.   The atmosphere. Was very pleasant. We were greeted by our waiter promptly. She made a few wine suggestions  at our request. They had a pretty good wine bar and the wine was good. The food was great the flavors were well defined. I would go back. If I get a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Mezzo Bistro and Wine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have a great wine bar

U6Qb0AgF-zvDBmSCNbYJZg.text: I started coming to Mezzo for Trivia Night. I've come a couple times and it is sooo much fun! Great prizes like show tickets, wine, and gift certificates. Last time I was there I ordered the salmon, it was amazing! I've also had the ravioli and a few of the salads, all delicious! Our server Armando checked on us often and kept our drinks filled. One of the owners, Kelly, runs Trivia Night. He does a great job coming up with challenging questions, keeping the game fun, and just being friendly and personable with all the customers. I'll definitely be back.

dYZRM3AUNP-QlAe3T7WfhA.text: This is probably one of my top 5 Favorite Italian restaurants in vegas the food is Fresh and Delicious every time I come, However last night the waiter "steven" was absolutely oblivious to simple things like Indroducing himself, not to mention I had to ask for each refill, he checked on my fiance and I one time and never asked hows the food tasting he lacked complete hospitality and the food runner was more of a waiter then he was I was disgusted with his attitude and lack of professionalism ...  although the service was bad the food was amazing so I hope next time I have a better overall experience.

TEuPZ8G8-1mY0QiHc40NBg.text: Found this place on Yelp. The food was really really good! One of our party was vegan and they accommodated her with delicious options.  We ordered house salad (great), better salad (huge portion, light and delicious), grilled veggie appetizer (great seasoning), portobello pizza (added ricotta was delicious soft dough) and a vegan pizza (pizza with veggies and no cheese). All was yummy we enjoyed the food.  The service was not as fabulous. I don't like to dock stars on service when I think they are trying hence four stars but really the service was like a 2 Star. VERY slow, it seemed like there weren't enough waiters and they were a little unorganized. If you are not in a rush it's totally fine! Have some wine and relax. We had an infant so didn't want to spend two hours eating there.   Would definitely come back without a little one on parents night out. Food yum!

uOdxR3rTV9mk8rpB8RvZoA.text: What a cute hidden gem on this side of town tucked away in a strip mall. This is going to be our new date night spot. The bf was so impressed he said we could possibly have our reception here.  The ambiance has been well thought out. It's very dark, romantic, and cozy here.  The service was spot on but we were the only diners at the time.  I say check out the lunch menu for good prices because regular menu items were a little pricey.  The food was flavorful and came out in a timely manner and was piping hot!  There was enough to take home for later.  We didn't try any wine, but we will save that for our next dinner date.  I loved the amount of seating in the place. There was the bar, the for mentioned private dining room, and at least 20 tables/booths to chose from.  I really would like to see this place stay in business because its a great addition to this part of town which is otherwise known for it's numerous fast food locations.

RzyZD2xQUanBHRY-kRcP3g.text: So I ended up here last night because Don Michaels was closed. The restaurant is nicely decorated. The menu had a good variety. I assumed that the entrees came with soup or salad. We were a party of 3 and each ordered a regular pasta dish with chicken added and 2 soft drinks and water, our bill was $77! The food was ok but not like wow that's good stuff. It's overpriced considering all you get is white bread with your meal. I'm still in shock about the cost, service was decent. I had the seafood stew, loaded with clams, mussels, shrimp, salmon, calamari. The best I want to go back today. Excellent

4LYRnGYuqlvvbrg9E-HV8g.text: Man I am so behind on my reviews. I came to Mezzo due mainly because I am TIRED of Olive Garden and this location isn't too far from my area. TIHiZkk-isxkA48ZGZPIGw.text: Let's start with the service. Not the best we've had but also not terrible. We love when the waiters are more involved especially when the place has little to no people. 4tiP9iyKBtGeidZdofaHOw.text: In the mood for lunch was in the area. You wouldn't think this restaurant would be tucked in the middle of this strip mall.   Upon entering was greeted with warm customer service. Was quickly sat at a table and offered beverages. Menu said they had my fav Aqua Panna however being opened at 11, they were out. So I opted for hot tea, they didn't have earl grey but had other selections.   I ordered the meat and cheese board, and fettuccine with chicken, tiramisu, and a cannoli, plus bread with balsamic vinegar. Everything was very well prepared and the taste was wonderful. My fav was the cannoli.   There is plenty of interior table and booth seating, plus there is a separate room for larger parties. They even have an outdoor seating area with lights.   I would def recommend, prices are a reflection of quality and presentation   Location is Rancho/ Craig - ample parking

glBmoFQJRXgmbUB16uIRug.text: First check in of the year! Woo! Mezzo is a little ways from home if you live by the strip but it was well worth the drive! About 23 minutes from our house so not bad.   When we arrived I noticed the outside area has a nice space for those hotter days. I liked how they have lights all around the space for when it gets darker out. We walk inside and the atmosphere is just perfect! There were only a few people inside enjoying their meals so there was plenty of space to choose from for seating. We ended up sitting at one of the tables by the bar in full view of the tv so we could watch football.   The lighting in mezzo reminds me a little how bonefish grill has their space setup. Very dim and cozy but still swanky. You have to look hard to see people haha! Our server came and we ordered the baked ziti and the chicken wrap with fries and pesto mayo(it was still lunch time but almost over about 15 min til happy hour). The bread basket came out with olive oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping. We both loved the bread because it was very soft and they seemed to have baked garlic or something inside of it that added more flavor. The baked ziti was just how we like it: hot and cheesy, oozing ricotta and lots of sauce! Very good. The chicken wrap with fries was also delicious! I think there were roasted red peppers inside also which were good. The fries were nicely cut steak fries with garlic stuff sprinkled all over. Those got taken home along with the leftover bread and ziti.   The service was ok. We had to wait for our server maybe once or twice but wasn't anything to ruin our experience. We could see and hear a group of them at the bar chit chatting for most of our visit with certain servers breaking off to tend to their tables. Our server was great at helping us with getting our free house wines with check-in...yea free wine which was amazing. Room temp Cabernet that was sweet and smooth! The wine here is definitely a must. FYI if you want to do a groupon deal here you must purchase it 24 hrs prior.   We loved this spot and will definitely be back for happy hour and date night festivities. If you want to try a sample of things I suggest taking advantage of the happy hour here which runs everyday if I'm not mistaken! House wine for $4 is a steal!

HHKyu3j9iaY2WA-PORlGmA.text: Came here on May 21st to celebrate my birthday. This is exactly what I ate that day.  This was our first time here. I love Italian food and I really wanted to try this place since is really close to where I live. The food was okay, but I really don't know what happened I threw up that night and that was all I ate. It had to be the ravioli I ate there.  I didn't even want to eat any of my birthday cake cause I was not feeling good for the rest of the day.... So, I might give it a last chance and see how it goes.

L7HzS5K78SEc8CoS596MKA.text: So we used to frequent this place, but don't come around as often since Kelly left and the drive is far. We sat at the bar and had two apps, two entrees, and two glasses of Tobin James Zinfandel. The bartender/server was very polite and attentive. My husband had pasta fagioli soup and spicy chicken riggies which he always loves. I had a golden beet salad (yum!) and eggplant Parmesan with veggies instead of pasta.   Mezzo probably has my favorite eggplant Parmesan in town. It has no breading whatsoever, just layers of eggplant, sauce, and cheese baked in a ceramic dish.   I would definitely come back to Mezzo more often if it was closer to home. But if I'm ever in the northwest, I'll definitely have to make a stop in.

0qmceSX4Q3KffDz-zbai9w.text: Don't try to use a Groupon here!!!!!!  Bought my Groupon and it wasn't honored because my family was with me. They used theirs and I tried to use mine. Our tables were attached; but we were all on separate checks. I was told on the phone from the hostess that it was okay. Unfortunately, that isn't the case. The Groupon wasn't a selling factor of this place. As I was encouraged by the hostess to purchase it. They told me, I wasn't even aware prior. I would've happily purchased menu items full price, but upon arrival, the rudeness was enough to make anyone lose their appetite.   Go to Grape Street or Grape Vine!!! Better service, better food, better everything. Highly disappointed.

7DmBMU2SssM8AwQQAtiHxQ.text: This place used to be good. We had a special occasion this week and thought we would revisit where we had our first date. Sadly, it was a disappointing dinner. Service was mediocre and the food was not chef-worthy at all.  Hubby's chicken parmesan cutlets were overcooked--dark brown and hard, nothing golden about it. He's not the type to complain, so he worked at it and ate it. My veal piccata had globulets of congealed flour in the lemon-caper sauce, did not look very appealing, and the veal wasn't tender at all. Our server attempted to do her best, but she was inexperienced, so we kept our opinions to ourselves and just enjoyed what we could of the night.  One more thing...why would anyone serve a cup of espresso that is stone cold? We did comment on this! The other guy brought it, so our young server had to check and came back saying the espresso machine wasn't working. Again, really disappointing experience. There are way too many other very good Italian restaurants nearby, we won't waste our time or money here again.

vSQAf2H4LoWHNEyz_Jpcng.text: Disappointed.   Came for lunch at 11:15 am.  There was one table ahead of us.  Lunch arrived at 12:15 pm.  It was salty and not good. We ordered eggplant parm, tuscan chicken sandwich and margherita pizza with garlic fries.  Fries were not garlic, but season salt fries...and old.  Chicken sandwich was over salted.  Eggplant parm had 2 thinly sliced pieces of eggplant and an over abundance of cheese.  Unfortunately,  they make you wait so long for the food you're hungry enough to eat whatever is put in front of you.  The pizza was good.  The bus boy was awesome.  It's a shame there wasn't a manager on duty.  We will not be back

wbB-JQvpCDBKAmfGTzMpbA.text: I can't believe it's been almost six years since I wrote my review of Mezzo, so it time for an update. We've been back many times since then, but this time we went a little earlier than usual; we often are the last ones standing (or rather, sitting) when we eat out. I'm so glad we did, because we were in time for the music.  The owner, Sean, recognized us and gave me a hug, even though we haven't been there in a while. Let's face it, our town is blessed to have so many great restaurants that you'd have to eat out 3x/day x 365 days/year, and probably still not come close to hitting them all. And Mezzo is quite a drive, so it's a testament to the food, service and ambiance that we go as often as we do.  The musicians were playing when we entered - a wonderful jazz group called TriTones. They so obviously enjoyed what they were doing, and the trumpeter was having a lot of fun throwing in little riffs of Xmas and Chanukah music. I wish my camera were as good as the guy sitting next to me, who was able to get well-lit video on his iPhone. I guess it's time for an upgrade, because my videos were too dark to see anything.  But we came for the food, since the music was a pleasant surprise, and I'm happy to report that it's as good as ever. I hadn't had the Tuscan Tenderloin since my first visit, which I'd had a problem with, but decided to try it again. Sean assured me that I'd be happy with it, and I was. The large piece was accompanied by asparagus, some apple slices, and a light sauce, as well as a substantial serving of rigatoni.  We shared a house salad which, unlike our very first visit, was split by the kitchen. It was larger than expected, and well worth the $5 charge.   Unlike me, my husband polished off his glistening chicken marsala. I was full from the salad, asparagus, bread and bubbly, and took home enough meat and pasta to add a few things and make a second dinner for both of us.  Lovely ambiance, great food, good service and superb music - what's not to love?

photos.caption: Photo of Mezzo Bistro and Wine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan Tenderloin
Photo of Mezzo Bistro and Wine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Insalata di Mezzo - split by kitchen

6T0FU_9iPKfGlV7OKpjPVQ.text: Mezzo bistro is pretty good I always get the calamari as an appetizer and it's good, unfortunately last time it didn't come with the fried banana peppers as usual, it came with raw banana peppers.  I keep forgetting that their fettuccine Alfredo is not worth it here, way too creamy it doesn't have enough noodles. And I've ordered it twice and both times it was the same. But the chicken riggies are bomb, I crave them.  The chicken Marsala is also very good, a little on the sweeter side but the chicken is very juicy and soft. Both delicious.

MSFdhimOFxG6J3YBGFbpfA.text: This is a really nice intimate restaurant. I liked the decor. The setup was very cozy and the lighting gave a nice ambience. The service was good. Although, my server didn't really explain much or tell us the special. We overheard it from the next table and when I asked he said it's on the board, which was really dark to read, considering it was on a chalkboard ( remember I said the lights gave a nice ambience so it wasn't the brightest). That didn't take away from the fact that the food was delicious!  We had used a Groupon ... and mentioned it of course to our server first , just in case of any mishaps.  We ordered the calamari it was fresh and crisp and I liked the garnishing of Pepperoncinis. Warm bread & olive oil was served on the table as well. I ordered the chicken piccata it was delish, perfect blend of lemon and butter white wine as I expected the flavors to be. My hubby ordered the chicken Marsala it was also very Rich and tasted as expected ... delicious! The portions were pretty big for us... 2 pieces of check cutlets each. Both plates were served with angel hair pasta. We took home the rest. We were only able to eat one each LOL. Really liked this restaurant. Worth checking out.

heVoga4iLM7OPh7oXTjxPw.text: I really enjoy good Italian food, and as we travel a lot, we eat Italian all over the States, and most of the time we find non-chain restaurants quite good.  That certainly was not our experience here.  After reading other reviews on this restaurant, I was surprised at our experience, which was not stellar.   I had their Oriechette Calabrese, and the Pasta (little ears) appeared to have been grabbed by the handful, and squeezed, came in very large clumps which I had to CUT with a knife into smaller pieces to eat.  When it was suggested to the Host/Owner?/Waiter that there was a problem with the Pasta, he was somewhat arrogant and dismissive, and offered not even an apology.   My Wife had the Meat Lasagna, and she was disappointed that there was almost no pasta in it, just lots of sauce, and cheese.   We will likely not frequent this place again, especially with the chatter noise level that we experienced.    Not a quality Restaurant today in my opinion.  Seems like something's changed from when this place was getting rave reviews.  I just noticed that they're taking Groupon here, a pretty good indication that quanity (of customers), not necessarily quality and service is their priority. We
